ARABIC: ذُوقُوا۟ فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: 'Taste your torment! This is what you were trying to hasten!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (And told:) "Taste your punishment. This is what you were trying to hasten."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (and be told): “Taste your ordeal! This is what you were seeking to hasten.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and will be told, "Suffer the torment which you wanted to experience immediately".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And it will be said to them, “Taste your own roasting; this is what you were impatient for.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Taste you your trial! This is what you used to ask to be hastened!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Taste your persecution! this is what you would hasten on.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Taste your trial! This is that you were seeking to hasten.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (And it will be said unto them): Taste your torment (which ye inflicted). This is what ye sought to hasten.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Taste your trial. This is what you sought to hasten."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Taste your burning: this is that which ye sought to be hastened.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [and will be told]: ‘Taste your torment. This is what you used to hasten.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Taste ye your trial! This is what ye used to ask to be hastened!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Taste you your trial (burning)! This is what you used to ask to be hastened!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Taste your trial. This is what you have sought to hasten'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “Taste your ordeal. This is what you used to challenge.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:14] ‘Taste this torment of yours, this chastisement of yours. This, chastisement, is what you sought to hasten on!’, in the world in derision.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 610 The angels of the Fire will say to them: (Taste your torment. This) chastisement (is what ye sought to hasten) in the life of the world.
